meanings.definition: A compound of phosphorus with a more electropositive element or group.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the phosphide in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The phosphide was used in the production of fireworks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student swapped the phosphide with sugar in the experiment.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like a phosphide in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The phosphide glowed brightly under the microscope.

meanings.definition: A binary compound of phosphorus with a metal.
meanings.sent1: The miners discovered a valuable phosphide deposit.
meanings.sent2: The phosphide coating protected the metal from corrosion.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added phosphide instead of salt to the dish.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a phosphide, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The phosphide reacted vigorously when exposed to water.
